Structure of this website
The main content is presented in terms of "Before - During - After resarch", followed by a description of MPDL tools/services to help researchers. However, for data management purposes phases of the research process aren't necessarily distinct - some aspects should be considered at an early stage but require attention throughout a project.
 
Before research ("Start your project"): Early planning can save time at later stages of the research process, data management plans are increasingly required by research funders. Other subchapters are Legal-Ethical (how to deal with personal research data), file handling (file nomenclature, organization and versioning) and file formats (sustainable and preferably open ones are recommended).
During research ("Keep it running"): The main data management task during this phase is to store data safely as they are generated, with regular backups. Beyond and/or before storage, MPDL tools/services also support data acquisition and collaborative working during scientific projects.
After research ("Finalize it"): Data matter beyond the lifetime of a scientific research project, funding organizations generally require that data are kept for ten years. Publishers often require open sharing of data related to scientific publications. This section includes chapters on data repositories and licences recommended for scientific data.
MPDL Tools and Services help researchers for data acquisition (labfolder, LabCam), data storage and collaborative working (Keeper, «collective»), open data sharing (Edmond, DOI service) and long-term archival (Keeper, having a dual function). All services are briefly introduced, including how they can be contacted.
